title: A bag contains 3 red marbles, 2 blue marbles and 5 yellow marbles. One marble is drawn at random. What is the probability of getting a red marble? - Quora

response.answer_text: A bag contains 3 red marbles, 2 blue marbles and 5 yellow marbles. One marble is drawn at random. What is the probability of getting a red marble?  Assuming that the probability of drawing each marble is the same then we may proceed as follows: The total number of possible draws of 1 marble is [math]3+2+5=10[/math] and the total number of possible draws of a red marble in 1 draw is [math]3[/math] therefore the probability of getting a red in 1 draw is given by [math]\text{probability}=\dfrac{\text{possible successes}}{\text{total possible outcomes}}=\dfrac{3}{10}\qquad\blacksquare[/math] This is [math]0.3[/math] as a decimal or [math]30[/math]% as a percentage.

There are total 10 marbles. In that 3 red, 5 blue and 2 yellow. So the possibility draw a marble is 10. = 10/1 =10 in it 10 is the total number of marbles and 1 is the possibility of drawn one red marble. Total red marbles are 3. So the possibility of draw one marble in 3 marbles. =3/1=3 Final possibility draw a one marble in total. = 3/10 =0.3
